Package controller

Class MinesweeperController

java.lang.Object
controller.MinesweeperController
public class MinesweeperController
extends java.lang.Object
A controller class for the minesweeeper game. Holds a model and board instance and offers methods to interact with the game model. Supports methods to reveal a tile, flag a tile, reveal all mines on the board, determine if a save exists, determine if it's the first move, and determine if the game has been won or lost.
Author:
Gary Li, Daniel S. Lee, Robert Schnell, Merle Crutchfield

  • Method Details

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      Prints a string representation of the board. For convenience in testing only.

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Returns whether the game has been won.
      Returns:
      True if the game has been won, false otherwise

    • revealSpace

      public void revealSpace​(int row, int col)
      Calls the model's revealSpace method, which uses recursion to cave out the area of blank spaces done by a click. It checks to make sure that it is in range, and if not then it does nothing. It then checks if there is a bomb, which prompts the end of the game. Next, if it is a covered spot and there are 0 bombs nearby it clears itself and recursively calls again. The last condition is if it touches a bomb, which is will just reveal the spot.
      Parameters:
      row - A row coordinate
      col - A column coordinate

    • flagSpace

      public void flagSpace​(int row, int col)
      Flags a space on the board (removes if a flag existed).
      Parameters:
      row - A row coordinate
      col - A column coordinate

    • revealMines

      public void revealMines()
      Reveals all mines in the board. This method is called when the user clicks a mine.

    • isFirstMove

      public boolean isFirstMove()
      Returns whether the next move will be the user's first move.
      Returns:
      True if the user has not placed a move, false otherwise

    • hasSave

      public boolean hasSave()
      Returns whether the model has been loaded from a previously saved board.
      Returns:
      whether the model is loaded

    • hasLost

      public boolean hasLost()
      Returns whether the game has been lost.
      Returns:
      whether the game has been lost
